@enothereska 
https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/wiki/RocksDB-Bloom-Filter#memory-usage

Do you think increasing block size will improve performance?

I don't have much details with rocksdb, let me know if I am missing something.

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

@dguy addressed comments in your initial review, and also expanded test coverage.
After some testing I realized we needed to have the cache also respect the segmentation of the underlying store to have a consistent ordering between cache and underlying store, when querying for key ranges across segments.

This led me to change the caching stores to prefix every cache key with a segment id internally. One benefit of that, is that time range queries will now only scan relevant segments in the cache as well, potentially reducing the number of cache key to scan.

There were also some gotchas with respect to key ranges which were a bit tricker, so I added the upper/lowerRangeFixedSize to keep the optimized ranges for single key queries
Currently, only 4 out of 7 tests work. We should try to fix `shouldBeAbleToPerformMultipleTransactions` first.

@mjsax  This patch is ready for review whenever it is a good time for you. Appreciate your time and feedback. This has the changes requested in the following review: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2938/files. I had to close that one because I had some trouble uploading the latest changes to that branch after my VM crashed. Thank you.
@hachikuji Thanks for the feedback. For now, I tried to addressed them all except for the last one about modifying the signature of `assign`.
